title: Bug 120922: Improvement needed for 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor
description: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, a notification message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. However, it is unclear to the user what action needs to be taken to save or discard the changes. The notification dialog is titled 'Error' which may cause confusion.
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved. However, it is not clear to the user how to save the changes (or discard them, which is even more difficult). The error message is 'Source page is dirty.'
EB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, a clear and informative notification should be displayed, providing options to save or discard the changes. The notification dialog should have an appropriate title that accurately reflects its purpose.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Verify that a notification message is displayed indicating the need to save the changes.
5. Verify that the notification provides clear options to save or discard the changes.
6. Verify that the notification dialog has an appropriate title.
